sharksData.name: Pacific Sleeper Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The Pacific sleeper shark is one of the largest sharks in the world’s oceans, reaching an average length of 12 feet. They are both scavengers and predators and feed by sucking and cutting their prey.

additional_info.habitat: North Pacific, Arctic, and some temperate waters

sharksData.name: Bluntnose Sixgill Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The bluntnose sixgill shark, sometimes also known as a cow shark, is the largest of all hexanchoid sharks.

sharksData.name: Common Thresher Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The thresher shark is a unique-looking shark that has an elongated tailfin and lives in the world’s temperate as well as tropical oceans.

additional_info.feeding_behavior: Uses its tail to stun prey

sharksData.name: Great Hammerhead Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The great hammerhead shark is the largest of the hammerhead species. They have large, hammer-shaped heads and feed on everything from crustaceans to smaller sharks.

additional_info.reproduction: Can have up to 50 pups every two years

sharksData.name: Tiger Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: Tiger sharks are well-known for the dark stripes down their body that resemble a tiger’s stripes.

additional_info.feeding_behavior: Feed on fish, birds, seals, and sometimes trash

sharksData.name: Greenland Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The Greenland shark has the longest known lifespan of any vertebrate species, between 250-500 years.

additional_info.feeding_behavior: Eats anything it comes across in the depths

sharksData.name: Great White Shark
sharksData.average_weight: Females: 4,500 lbs (2041 kgs), Males: 1,400 lbs (635 kgs)
sharksData.interesting_fact: The great white shark is perhaps the best-known of all the large species of sharks in the earth’s oceans.

additional_info.feeding_behavior: Predator at the top of the food chain

sharksData.name: Megamouth Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The megamouth shark has a stout body and bulbous head with a mouth that extends behind its eyes.

sharksData.name: Basking Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The basking shark is one of the largest sharks in the world and is a filter feeder.

sharksData.name: Whale Shark
sharksData.interesting_fact: The whale shark is the most well-known largest shark in the earth’s oceans.
